results.firPara: • Manager hints at recall for Everton midfielder for Burnley tri
results.secPara: Ronald Koeman has said Ross Barkleys omission against Manchester City should serve as a wake-up call to the Everton midfielder about the need for more aggression and end product in his game.
results.webTitle: Ronald Koeman hopes dropping Ross Barkley for Everton will be wake-up call

results.firPara: The presence of Wayne Rooney and Robin van Persie revived memories of when Manchester United were last a force. Those halcyon days occurred three long years ago when a record 20th championship was claimed at Old Trafford on an April night. Van Persies hat-trick sank Aston Villa and Sir Alex Ferguson lauded the Dutchmans second strike as the goal of the century.
results.secPara: It was a sweet over-the-shoulder volley that Van Persie hit on 13 minutes to give Brad Guzan no chance. The provider? Rooney, whose placing in midfield during that season began the quandary over his best position that is a key factor in the loss of his automatic starting status.
results.webTitle: Wayne Rooney battles to avoid joining Robin van Persie as a United relic | Jamie Jackson

results.firPara: Paul Pogba scored twice and Robin van Persie was on target on his Old Trafford return as United recorded a confidence-boosting win before the trip to Chelsea
results.secPara: A dire 30 minutes was followed by three goals in 15 minutes, including two confidence-boosters for Paul Pogba. Juan Mata and Michael Carrick impressed and Wayne Rooney was bright and inventive in attack too. Things are looking up before Chelsea visit Old Trafford. Thanks for keeping me company. The match report is here.
results.webTitle: Manchester United v Fenerbahce: Europa League – as it happened

results.firPara: Sam Allardyce has appeared in public for the first time since addressing the media the day after he left his post as England manager, attending Manchester Uniteds Europa League match against Fenerbahce.
results.secPara: Allardyce, who was pictured sitting next to Sir Alex Ferguson at Old Trafford, has been firmly out of the spotlight since 28 September, after leaving the England job by mutual consent. He was in charge for just 67 days before departing over revelations in an undercover newspaper investigation. Facing the media after his departure was announced, Allardyce admitted to an error of judgment before leaving with family for an overseas holiday.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce pictured at Manchester United’s match against Fenerbahce

results.firPara: The supporters trust at Swansea City, for years praised as a model club run as a partnership with fans, has angrily criticised the chairman, Huw Jenkins, and other former shareholders for making millions of pounds by selling to US investors.
results.secPara: The trust owns 21% of the club and worked with Jenkins and a small group of other shareholders to rescue Swansea from crisis in 2002. The trusts board complains that they were bypassed when the sale happened in June.
results.webTitle: Swansea City accused of ignoring supporters trust as relations sour

results.firPara: Wellington Phoenixs coach has been there won it all, but a poor last season has the leagues most experienced manager bristling
results.secPara: Wellington Phoenixs coach has been there won it all, but a poor last season has the leagues most experienced manager bristling
results.webTitle: Ernie Merrick: the A-League’s elder statesman still burning for success | Richard Parkin

results.firPara: That could barely have gone worse for Southampton. For so long a famous victory looked there for the taking but instead they leave the San Siro with nothing but a slightly sickening feeling. Inter may not be the force they one were but they still handed out a painful lesson, punishing Saints for errant finishing and a moment of slack defending. The group is anyones now.
results.secPara: 90+4 min After tricky work by Boufal, Van Dijk tries to get off a shot at the edge of the area. It bounces off a defender to Ward-Prowse, who tries a scissors volley from the edge of the box. It goes agonisingly wide.
results.webTitle: Internazionale v Southampton: Europa League – as it happened

results.firPara: The goalkeeper Gary Sprake, who has died aged 71, was a foundation stone of the great Leeds United side of the late 1960s and early 70s under its legendary manager Don Revie. An ever-present in the football team that took the First Division championship in 1968/69, he also won two Fairs Cup medals in Europe with Leeds during a highly successful 11-year career at Elland Road, and was a mainstay for Wales, with whom he won 37 caps between 1963 and 1974.
results.secPara: Strong, agile, well-built and craggy of face, Sprake looked as much like a rugged mountaineer as a goalkeeper. Although there were bigger names in that dominant and robust Leeds side, he was more integral to the success of the Revie era than many gave him credit for. During the championship winning season of 1968/69 – the first top flight title for Leeds – he played in all 42 league matches and kept clean sheets in more than half of them.
